org.htwk.graphplot.expression

Class ExpressionInterpreter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.htwk.graphplot.expression.ExpressionInterpreter

  • public class ExpressionInterpreter
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a factory class for expressions. It can transform a given string with known operations and functions into a calculable object.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    René Martin, Sophie Eckenstaler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ExpressionInterpreter(java.lang.String inputExpression)
      This constructor initializes the transformation of a given string into a calculable object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Expression getExpression()
      Creates a new calculable object from the string given in the consturctor

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExpressionInterpreter

        public ExpressionInterpreter(java.lang.String inputExpression)
                      throws InvalidExpressionException
        This constructor initializes the transformation of a given string into a calculable object.
        Parameters:
        inputExpression - The string which shall be transformed
        Throws:
        InvalidExpressionException - is thrown if the given string does not represent a proper expression.

    • Method Detail

      • getExpression

        public Expression getExpression()
                         throws InvalidExpressionException
        Creates a new calculable object from the string given in the consturctor
        Returns:
        A calculable expression object
        Throws:
        InvalidExpressionException - is thrown if the given string does not represent a proper expression or has unknown functions or operations.
